item.title: ATI make fun of Fermi's heat and power consumption
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:12, topic:354234”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=450527.msg3305110#msg3305110 date=1281603832]
Poor marketing in my opinion. Most good things in life uses a fuck load of power and generates a load of heat. Most Nvidia cards perform better than the ATi equivilant even if it uses significantly more power.

You buy a GTX470/480 because you want performance, not a card that saves the environment. It’s like buying a ferrari - you only buy it for the speed and ignore all the other factors.
[/quote]

In all honesty when I’m im my room it actually heats up after about an hour of my door being closed and my computer on, and thats with the radeon 5850, I can only imagine what it would be like with a fermi,[/quote]

Then you don’t need a radiator in your room. When you buy a fermi you get two things in one: an amazing graphics card and central heating.
After looking it up, at both idle and at load the GTX480 is 15C hotter than the 5850. Yes, it nearly hits 100C under load and idles at just under 60, but that can be useful during a cold winters day!

Read full topic

item.source: ATI make fun of Fermi's heat and power consumption

item.title: ATI make fun of Fermi's heat and power consumption
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

saw this awhile ago, it’s pretty pathetic on ATI’s behalf. For years Crossfire scaling has sucked, their drivers have sucked, they have had less market share and other yet Nvidia has not tried to do something like this.

Funny thing is, this video was made right around the time nvidia released GF104 (fermi done correctly) which you see in the GTX460 chip. give it a few months and there will be a GTX470/480 done ‘right’.

GTX460 is just as cool and uses just as less power as the ATI range, and SLI GTX460s perform at crossfire 5870 levels (e.g nearly twice as expensive).

Read full topic
item.source: ATI make fun of Fermi's heat and power consumption

item.title: ATI make fun of Fermi's heat and power consumption
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:354234”]Basically ATI is pissed because NVIDIA makes cards that are so much better, and instead of trying to improve their own product, they say “Well, they do have much better performance, but they make slightly more heat and use more power than our cards, so buy from us!”. Idiots.

My Acer with a Pentium 486 and 4 megabytes of RAM uses less power and makes less heat than your computer, maybe you should buy it from me and use it instead too!!![/quote]

Nah. They are actually capitalising on the fact NVIDIA’s GTX480 and GTX470 were not reviewed as well as ATI’s cards they launched like 6 months before. Reviews said, they were using up too much power and too much heat generated, for too high price for not enough power.

This time around ATI actually have the better cards, with NVIDIA only being able to take out one area of their lineup with the GTX460. This is the first time I’ve gone with ATI in years because NVIDIA /did/ have the better cards. I read all the reviews, ATI got it right this time and NVIDIA didn’t know what to do. You can read all the reviews yourself.

Besides being just a bit of fun, NVIDIA have been doing this sort of stuff to ATI for years.

Read full topic
